Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AP138 analog A2 (Synthetic AMPs, plectasin analog, 3S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, fungal defensin analog, fungi-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 97.5% similar toAP138L-arg26C: 15%, G: 20%.Activity: active against S. aureus MRSA ATCC 43300 (MIC 4 ug/ml). Warning: other bacteria not tested (other Gram+ or Gram-negative bacteria not tested).Antimicrobial robustness: Peptide is active in 25% plasma (MIC 16 ug/ml):plasma-sensitive, NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus (150 mM), KCl-insensitive:S. aureus (2.5 mM), CaCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (2.5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (2.5 mM).
Literature Information.Author: Zhang K, Yang N, Mao R, Hao Y, Teng D, Wang J. 2024
Literature Information.Title: An amphipathic peptide combats multidrug-resistant Staphylococcus aureus and biofilms.
